title: RondoDox Botnet Exploits Critical React2Shell Flaw to Hijack IoT Devices and Web Servers
summary: The RondoDox botnet has been exploiting a severe vulnerability known as React2Shell to take control of Internet of Things (IoT) devices and web servers. This critical flaw allows malicious actors to gain unauthorized access and execute arbitrary code remotely, potentially compromising vast networks of connected devices. Security researchers have identified the vulnerability within systems using the popular React framework. title: States Tried to Censor Kids Online. Courts, and EFF, Mostly Stopped Them: 2025 in Review
summary: In 2025, various U.S. states attempted to implement laws aimed at restricting children's access to online content, citing concerns over safety and appropriate material. However, these efforts largely faced significant legal challenges, with courts often ruling against such measures on the grounds of First Amendment rights and the difficulty in effectively enforcing these restrictions. title: Two US Cybersecurity Pros Plead Guilty Over Ransomware Attacks
summary: Two U.S. cybersecurity professionals have pleaded guilty to charges related to ransomware attacks they were involved in orchestrating. The individuals admitted to exploiting their expertise to carry out cyberattacks for financial gain, marking a significant breach of trust within the cybersecurity community. Their actions included developing and deploying ransomware that targeted various organizations, encrypting victim data, and demanding payment for decryption keys. This case highlights the ongoing challenges in combating cybercrime, as well as the potential threats posed by insiders with advanced technical skills.

title: Congress's Crusade to Age Gate the Internet: 2025 in Review
summary: In 2025, Congress launched a vigorous campaign to implement age restrictions across the internet, driven by concerns over children's online safety and exposure to inappropriate content. This movement aimed to establish comprehensive age verification systems on various platforms, with a focus on social media and content-sharing sites. Critics argued that these measures could infringe on privacy rights and stifle free expression, while supporters emphasized the need for robust protections for minors in the digital age. title: Transparent Tribe Launches New RAT Attacks Against Indian Government and Academia
summary: Transparent Tribe, a notorious cyber-espionage group believed to be linked to Pakistan, has initiated a series of sophisticated Remote Access Trojan (RAT) attacks targeting Indian government and academic sectors. These new campaigns aim to gather sensitive information by exploiting vulnerabilities in digital communication channels. Employing a combination of phishing emails and malicious attachments, Transparent Tribe seeks to infiltrate systems and maintain persistent access to extract data over time.
